fi.sewsiaica.uusiaika.dialogue

Class Dialogue

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.sewsiaica.uusiaika.dialogue.Dialogue

  • public class Dialogue
extends Object
    This class contains all the dialogue text (ie all the text, including the button names) in the game. Each language has its own hash map of the dialogue. These hash maps, in turn, are included in the languages hash map. The language settings are handled by the LanguageHandler class in the logic package, as is the addition of new languages.
    Author:
    iah1016

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dialogue()
      The constructor creates immutable objects of the following types: GeneralTools, ReadFromInputStream, HashMap (the map of all the languages), String[] (the keys for language maps that are used for the validity checks).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<String,String> getLangMap(String languageName)
      This method will return the language map corresponding to the language name given as a parameter or null if the languages map does not contain the requested language.
      List<String> getNamesOfLanguages()
      The names of each language given as a string.
      protected boolean languageLoader(InputStream inputStream)
      This protected method uses the ReadFromInputStream object to get the String lines from the language file.
      boolean loadNewLanguage(File languageFile)
      This method will add a (valid) language to the hash map of languages.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dialogue

        public Dialogue()
        The constructor creates immutable objects of the following types: GeneralTools, ReadFromInputStream, HashMap (the map of all the languages), String[] (the keys for language maps that are used for the validity checks).

    • Method Detail

      • getLangMap

        public Map<String,String> getLangMap(String languageName)
        This method will return the language map corresponding to the language name given as a parameter or null if the languages map does not contain the requested language.
        Parameters:
        languageName - The language name given as a string.
        Returns:
        Returns the language map if found or null if not found.

      • getNamesOfLanguages

        public List<String> getNamesOfLanguages()
        The names of each language given as a string. The language name is needed as a key to retrieve the language map from the larger map that contains all the languages.
        Returns:
        Returns the language names in a String-type List.

      • loadNewLanguage

        public boolean loadNewLanguage(File languageFile)
        This method will add a (valid) language to the hash map of languages.
        Parameters:
        languageFile - The text file that contains all the dialogue in this language.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the file is valid.

      • languageLoader

        protected boolean languageLoader(InputStream inputStream)
        This protected method uses the ReadFromInputStream object to get the String lines from the language file. Not private due to testing.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The InputStream given.
        Returns:
        Returns true if loading succeeds, false if there is either an IOException or a NullPointerException.
